Package org.ejbca.ui.web

Class RequestHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ejbca.ui.web.RequestHelper
  • public class RequestHelper
extends Object
    Helper class for handling certificate request from browsers or general PKCS#10
    Version:
    $Id: RequestHelper.java 28947 2018-05-17 08:51:45Z jekaterina_b_helmes $

      CertificateRequestResponse pkcs10CertRequest​(SignSessionLocal signsession, CaSessionLocal caSession, byte[] b64Encoded, String username, String password, CertificateResponseType resulttype)  
      CertificateRequestResponse pkcs10CertRequest​(SignSessionLocal signsession, CaSessionLocal caSession, byte[] b64Encoded, String username, String password, CertificateResponseType resulttype, boolean doSplitLines)
      Handles PKCS10 certificate request, these are constructed as: CertificationRequest ::= SEQUENCE { certificationRequestInfo CertificationRequestInfo, signatureAlgorithm AlgorithmIdentifier{{ SignatureAlgorithms }}, signature BIT STRING } CertificationRequestInfo ::= SEQUENCE { version INTEGER { v1(0) } (v1,...), subject Name, subjectPKInfo SubjectPublicKeyInfo{{ PKInfoAlgorithms }}, attributes [0] Attributes{{ CRIAttributes }}} SubjectPublicKeyInfo { ALGORITHM : IOSet} ::= SEQUENCE { algorithm AlgorithmIdentifier {{IOSet}}, subjectPublicKey BIT STRING } PublicKey's encoded-format has to be RSA X.509.
      static void sendB64BinaryBytes​(byte[] bytes, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse out, String contentType, String filename)
      Sends back a number of bytes first encoded as base64
      static void sendBinaryBytes​(byte[] bytes, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse out, String contentType, String filename)
      Sends back a number of bytes
      static void sendNewB64Cert​(byte[] b64cert, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse out, String beginKey, String endKey)
      Sends back certificate as binary file (application/octet-stream)
      static void sendNewB64File​(byte[] b64cert, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse out, String filename, String beginKey, String endKey)
      Sends back certificate as binary file (application/octet-stream)
      static void sendNewCertToIEClient​(byte[] b64cert, OutputStream out, javax.servlet.ServletContext sc, String responseTemplate, String classid)
      Reads template and inserts cert to send back to IE for installation of cert
      static void sendNewCertToNSClient​(byte[] certs, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse out)
      Sends back cert to Firefox for installation of cert
      static void sendNewX509CaCert​(byte[] cert, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse out)
      Sends back CA-certificate as binary file (application/x-x509-ca-cert)
      static void sendResultPage​(byte[] certbytes, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse out, boolean hidemenu, String installToBrowser)
      Sends a page with certificate information and an automatic redirect to the download page.

      Sends a page with certificate information and an automatic redirect to the download page.

      Sets the default character encoding for decoding post and get parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • nsCertRequest

        public byte[] nsCertRequest​(SignSessionLocal signsession,
                            byte[] reqBytes,
                            String username,
                            String password)
                     throws javax.ejb.ObjectNotFoundException,
                            CADoesntExistsException,
                            EjbcaException,
                            AuthorizationDeniedException,
                            CesecoreException,
                            CertificateEncodingException,
                            InvalidKeyException,
                            NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                            SignatureException,
                            NoSuchProviderException
        Handles Firefox certificate request (KEYGEN), these are constructed as: SignedPublicKeyAndChallenge ::= SEQUENCE { publicKeyAndChallenge PublicKeyAndChallenge, signatureAlgorithm AlgorithmIdentifier, signature BIT STRING } PublicKey's encoded-format has to be RSA X.509.
        Parameters:
        signsession - EJB session to signature bean.
        reqBytes - buffer holding te request from NS.
        username - username in EJBCA for authoriation.
        password - users password for authorization.
        Returns:
        byte[] containing DER-encoded certificate.
        Throws:
        CesecoreException - fail
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        EjbcaException - fail
        CADoesntExistsException - fail
        javax.ejb.ObjectNotFoundException - fail
        CertificateEncodingException - fail
        NoSuchProviderException - fail
        SignatureException - fail
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - fail
        InvalidKeyException - fail

      • pkcs10CertRequest

        public CertificateRequestResponse pkcs10CertRequest​(SignSessionLocal signsession,
                                                    CaSessionLocal caSession,
                                                    byte[] b64Encoded,
                                                    String username,
                                                    String password,
                                                    CertificateResponseType resulttype,
                                                    boolean doSplitLines)
                                             throws EjbcaException,
                                                    CesecoreException,
                                                    AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                                    CertificateEncodingException,
                                                    CertificateException,
                                                    CertificateExtensionException
        Handles PKCS10 certificate request, these are constructed as: CertificationRequest ::= SEQUENCE { certificationRequestInfo CertificationRequestInfo, signatureAlgorithm AlgorithmIdentifier{{ SignatureAlgorithms }}, signature BIT STRING } CertificationRequestInfo ::= SEQUENCE { version INTEGER { v1(0) } (v1,...), subject Name, subjectPKInfo SubjectPublicKeyInfo{{ PKInfoAlgorithms }}, attributes [0] Attributes{{ CRIAttributes }}} SubjectPublicKeyInfo { ALGORITHM : IOSet} ::= SEQUENCE { algorithm AlgorithmIdentifier {{IOSet}}, subjectPublicKey BIT STRING } PublicKey's encoded-format has to be RSA X.509.
        Parameters:
        signsession - signsession to get certificate from
        caSession - a reference to CaSessionBean
        b64Encoded - base64 encoded pkcs10 request message
        username - username of requesting user
        password - password of requesting user
        resulttype - should indicate if a PKCS7 or just the certificate is wanted.
        doSplitLines - bool
        Returns:
        Base64 encoded byte[]
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        CesecoreException - fail
        EjbcaException - fail
        CertificateException - fail
        CertificateEncodingException - fail
        CertificateExtensionException - if b64Encoded specified invalid extensions

      • pkcs10CertRequest

        @Deprecated
public byte[] pkcs10CertRequest​(SignSessionLocal signsession,
                                CaSessionLocal caSession,
                                byte[] b64Encoded,
                                String username,
                                String password,
                                int resulttype,
                                boolean doSplitLines)
                         throws EjbcaException,
                                CesecoreException,
                                AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                CertificateEncodingException,
                                CertificateException,
                                CertificateExtensionException
        Deprecated.
        Since 6.1.0, remove in 7.0.0. Use the other overloaded version taking a CertificateResponseType in the resulttype parameter.
        Parameters:
        signsession - session
        caSession - CA
        b64Encoded - bytes
        username - user
        password - pwd
        resulttype - type
        doSplitLines - bool
        Returns:
        req
        Throws:
        EjbcaException - fail
        CesecoreException - fail
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        CertificateEncodingException - fail
        CertificateException - dail
        CertificateExtensionException - fail

      • cvcCertRequest

        public byte[] cvcCertRequest​(SignSessionLocal signsession,
                             byte[] b64Encoded,
                             String username,
                             String password)
                      throws Exception
        Handles CVC certificate requests. These are the special certificates for EAC ePassport PKI.
        Parameters:
        signsession - signsession to get certificate from
        b64Encoded - base64 encoded cvc request message
        username - username of requesting user
        password - password of requesting user
        Returns:
        Base64 encoded byte[]
        Throws:
        Exception - fail

      • sendNewCertToIEClient

        public static void sendNewCertToIEClient​(byte[] b64cert,
                                         OutputStream out,
                                         javax.servlet.ServletContext sc,
                                         String responseTemplate,
                                         String classid)
                                  throws Exception
        Reads template and inserts cert to send back to IE for installation of cert
        Parameters:
        b64cert - cert to be installed in IE-client
        out - utput stream to send to
        sc - serveltcontext
        responseTemplate - path to responseTemplate
        classid - replace
        Throws:
        Exception - on error

                                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse out)
                                  throws Exception
        Sends back cert to Firefox for installation of cert
        Parameters:
        certs - DER encoded certificates to be installed in browser
        out - output stream to send to
        Throws:
        Exception - on error

      • sendNewB64File

        public static void sendNewB64File​(byte[] b64cert,
                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse out,
                                  String filename,
                                  String beginKey,
                                  String endKey)
                           throws IOException
        Sends back certificate as binary file (application/octet-stream)
        Parameters:
        b64cert - base64 encoded certificate to be returned
        out - output stream to send to
        filename - filename sent as 'Content-disposition' header
        beginKey - String containing key information, i.e. BEGIN_CERTIFICATE_WITH_NL or BEGIN_PKCS7_WITH_NL
        endKey - String containing key information, i.e. END_CERTIFICATE_WITH_NL or END_PKCS7_WITH_NL
        Throws:
        IOException - on error

      • sendNewB64Cert

        public static void sendNewB64Cert​(byte[] b64cert,
                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse out,
                                  String beginKey,
                                  String endKey)
                           throws IOException
        Sends back certificate as binary file (application/octet-stream)
        Parameters:
        b64cert - base64 encoded certificate to be returned
        out - output stream to send to
        beginKey - String containing key information, i.e. BEGIN_CERTIFICATE_WITH_NL or BEGIN_PKCS7_WITH_NL
        endKey - String containing key information, i.e. END_CERTIFICATE_WITH_NL or END_PKCS7_WITH_NL
        Throws:
        IOException - on error

                                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse out)
                              throws IOException
        Sends back CA-certificate as binary file (application/x-x509-ca-cert)
        Parameters:

      • sendBinaryBytes

        public static void sendBinaryBytes​(byte[] bytes,
                                   javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse out,
                                   String contentType,
                                   String filename)
                            throws IOException
        Sends back a number of bytes
        Parameters:
        bytes - DER encoded certificate to be returned
        out - output stream to send to
        contentType - mime type to send back bytes as
        filename - to call the file in a Content-disposition, can be null to leave out this header
        Throws:
        IOException - on error

      • sendB64BinaryBytes

        public static void sendB64BinaryBytes​(byte[] bytes,
                                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse out,
                                      String contentType,
                                      String filename)
                               throws IOException
        Sends back a number of bytes first encoded as base64
        Parameters:
        bytes - Data to be encoded
        out - output stream to send to
        contentType - mime type to send back bytes as
        filename - to call the file in a Content-disposition, can be null to leave out this header
        Throws:
        IOException - on error

      • sendResultPage

        public static void sendResultPage​(byte[] certbytes,
                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse out,
                                  boolean hidemenu,
                                  CertificateResponseType resulttype)
                           throws Exception
        Sends a page with certificate information and an automatic redirect to the download page. The issuer must not be a "throw away" CA.
        Parameters:
        certbytes - DER encoded certificate
        out - output stream to send to
        hidemenu - whether the menu should be hidden (translates to the "hidemenu" URL parameter)
        resulttype - type of desired result, e.g. cert, certchain, pkcs7...
        Throws:
        Exception - fail

      • sendResultPage

        public static void sendResultPage​(byte[] certbytes,
                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse out,
                                  boolean hidemenu,
                                  String installToBrowser)
                           throws Exception
        Sends a page with certificate information and an automatic redirect to the download page. The issuer must not be a "throw away" CA. The certificate is automatically installed in the browser.
        Parameters:
        certbytes - bytes
        out - response
        hidemenu - bool
        installToBrowser - Browser type. Only "netscape" is supported, which means "most browsers except IE".
        Throws:
        Exception - fail

      • setDefaultCharacterEncoding

        public static void setDefaultCharacterEncoding​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
                                        throws UnsupportedEncodingException
        Sets the default character encoding for decoding post and get parameters. First tries to get the character encoding from the request, if the browser is so kind to tell us which it is using, which it never does... Otherwise, when the browser is silent, it sets the character encoding to the same encoding that we use to display the pages.
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest
        Throws:
        UnsupportedEncodingException - fail

      • getFileNameFromCertNoEnding

        public static String getFileNameFromCertNoEnding​(Certificate cacert,
                                                 String defaultname)
                                          throws NoSuchFieldException
        Throws:
        NoSuchFieldException

      • getRequestServerName

        public static String getRequestServerName​(String request)
        Method that returns the servername including port, extracted from the HTTPServlet Request, no protocol or application path is returned
        Parameters:
        request - req
        Returns:
        the server name and port requested, i.e. localhost:8443
